hotspots.hotspot:
Public opinion poll

Survey of a given population's opinion on an issue or a candidate at a particular point in time

Straw poll

Poll conducted in an unscientific manner, used to predict election outcomes

Population

In a poll, the group of people whose opinions are of interest and/or about whom information is desired

Random sampling

Scientific method of selection for a poll in which each member of the population has an equal chance at being included in the sample

Sampling error

Statistical calculation of the difference in results between a poll of a randomly drawn sample and a poll of the entire population

Tracking polls

Polls that measure changes in public opinion over the course of days, weeks, or months by repeatedly asking respondents the same questions and measuring changes in their responses

Push polls

Special type of poll that provides information to campaigns about candidate strengths and weaknesses and attempts to skew public opinion about a candidate

Exit polls

Polls conducted at voting sites on an election day to project the winner of an election before the polls close
